attributes.title: Can We Build a Brain? Preview
attributes.title_sortable: Can We Build a Brain? Preview
attributes.description_short: How does today’s artificial intelligence actually work—and is it truly intelligent?
attributes.description_long: Artificially intelligent machines are taking over. They’re influencing our everyday lives in profound and often invisible ways. They can read handwriting, interpret emotions, play games, and even act as personal assistants. They are in our phones, our cars, our doctors’ offices, our banks, our web searches…the list goes on and is rapidly growing ever longer.
attributes.funder_message:
National corporate funding for NOVA Wonders is provided by Draper. Major funding for NOVA Wonders is provided by National Science Foundation, the Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation, the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation and public television viewers, with additional funding for “Are We Alone?” and “What’s the Universe Made Of?” provided by the John Templeton Foundation.
This material is based upon work supported by the National Science Foundation under Grant No. DRL-1420749. Any opinions, findings, and conclusions or recommendations expressed in this material are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of the National Science Foundation.

attributes.title: NOVA Wonder's "Can We Build a Brain?" Homepage
Bias in Artificial Intelligence
attributes.description_short: AI systems don’t think exactly like humans, but the algorithms can—and do—play favorites.

attributes.title: Will Robots Become Conscious?
attributes.description_short: What makes a brain or machine conscious? This theory is beginning to provide some answers.

attributes.title: Unlocking the Brain's Secrets
attributes.description_short: Neuroscientists are beginning to unravel the brain’s mysterious perineuronal nets.

attributes.title: Can Machines Think Like Us?
attributes.description_short: A computer named Watson is the latest contestant in machine v. human battles.

attributes.title: NOVA Wonders Can We Build a Brain?
Meet the Robots at Amazon
attributes.description_short: Will robots take over the world?
attributes.description_long: Will robots take over the world?
